key_points: Nearly 700,000 firearms were bought or attempted to be bought during Black Friday sales according to the FBI.
FBI processed a record-breaking 187,585 background checks for gun purchases on Black Friday.
The pistol used in the Oxford High School shooting in Michigan was bought on Black Friday by the suspect's father.
The 2021 Black Friday ranks among the top 10 highest days for firearm background checks since 1998.
The Oxford High School shooting has reignited debates over gun safety and laws in Michigan.
Michigan is ranked 20th by the Giffords Law Center for states with the strictest gun laws.
Michigan's Democratic Governor, Gretchen Whitmer, referred to gun violence as a 'public health crisis.'
Meshawn Maddock, co-chair of the Michigan Republican Party, expressed support for armed teachers.
The shooting is considered the sixth mass shooting in 2021, contrasting with two in 2020.
Support for stricter gun control has diminished, with only 52% of Americans in favor according to a Gallup poll.
